Euro-Mediterranean Observatories

The following table shows an aggregation of observatories and institutes that operate seismic instruments in the Euro-Mediterranean region. Please contact us if this information is incorrect or outdated.

** Institutes and Observatories **

  • Albania, Tirana (Institute of Geosciences)

  • Algeria, Alger (Centre de Recherche en Astronomie, Astrophysique et Géophysique)

  • Armenia, Yerevan (Institute of Geophysics, National Academy of Sciences of Armenia)

  • Austria, Vienna (International Data Center of the Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organisation)

  • Austria, Vienna (ZentralAnstalt für Meteorologie und Geodynamik)

  • Azerbaijan, Baku (Republican Seismic Survey Center of Azerbaijan National, Academy of Sciences)

  • Belarus, Minsk (The Centre of Geophysical Monitoring of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus)

  • Belgium, Brussels (Royal Observatory of Belgium)

  • Bosnia-Herzogovina, Banja Luka (Republic Hydrometeorological Service, Banja Luka, Republic of Srpska, Bosnia-Herzogovina)

  • Bulgaria, Sofia (National Institute of Geophysics, Geodesy and Geography of Bulgarian Academy of Sciences)

  • Croatia, Zagreb (Department of Geophysics, University of Zagreb)

  • Croatia, Zagreb (Croation Seismological Survey, Dept. of Geophysics, University of Zagreb)

  • Czech Republic, Prague (Geophysical Institute, Academy of Sciences of Czech Republic)

  • Czech Republic, Brno (Institute of Physics of the Earth, Masaryk University)

  • Denmark, Copenhagen (Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland)

  • Djibouti, Arta (Observatoire Géophysique d’Arta)

  • Egypt, Cairo (National Research Institute of Astronomy and Geophysics)

  • Estonia, Tallinn (Geological Survey of Estonia)

  • Ethiopia, Addis Abeba (Geophysical Observatory, University of Addis Abeba)

  • Finland, Helsinki (Institute of Seismology, University of Helsinki)

  • France, Paris (GEOSCOPE Program)

  • France, Strasbourg (Réseau National de Surveillance Sismique (RéNaSS))

  • France, Bruyeres-le-Chatel (Laboratoire de Detection et de Geophysique)

  • France, Bruyeres-le-Chatel (European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre)

  • France, Grenoble (Observatoire de Grenoble)

  • France, Grenoble (Observatoire de Grenoble)

  • France, Grenoble (French Accelerometric Network)

  • France, Toulouse (Observatoire Midi-Pyrenees Serveur de Données Sismiques)

  • France, Nice (Geosciences-Azur)

  • Georgia, Tbilisi (Seismic Monitoring Centre)

  • Germany, Hannover (Seismological Central Observatory)

  • Germany, Potsdam (Seismological Data Center)

  • Germany, Bensberg / Cologne (Erdbebenstation Bensberg, Geological Institute, University of Cologne)

  • Germany, Black Forest (Black Forest Observatory)

  • Germany, Bochum (Seismological Observatory, Ruhr University)

  • Germany, Freiburg (LandesErdbebenDienst Baden Württemberg)

  • Germany, Hannover (German regional Seismic Network)

  • Germany, Jena (Applied Geophysics, University of Jena)

  • Germany, Krefeld (Geologischer Dienst Nordrhein-Westfalen)

  • Germany, Muenchen (Seismological Observatory Fürstenfeldbruck)

  • Germany, Muenchen (Erdbebendienst Bayern)

  • Germany, Stuttgart (Institute of Geophysics, University of Stuttgart)

  • Greece, Athens (National Observatory of Athens, Geodynamic Institute)

  • Greece, Athens (Hellenic Seismological Broadband Network)

  • Greece, Athens (Geophysical Institute, Athens University)

  • Greece, Chania, Crete (Technological Educational Institute of Crete, Seismological Network of Crete (HSNC))

  • Greece, Patras (Laboratory of Seismology, University of Patras)

  • Greece, Thessaloniki (Department of Geophysics, University of Thessaloniki)

  • Hungaria, Budapest (Kovesligethy Rado Seismological Observatory, Research Centre for Astronomy and Earth Sciences)

  • Iceland, Reykjavik (Department of Geophysics, Icelandic Meteorological Office)

  • Iran, Tehran (Institute of Earthquake Engineering Seismology)

  • Iran, Tehran (Iran National seismic Network, University of Tehran)

  • Ireland, Dublin (Dublin Institute for Advanced Studies)

  • Israel, Lod (Seismology Division, Geophysical Institute of Israel)

  • Italy, Trieste (Istituto Nazionale di Oceanografia e di Geofisica Sperimentale)

  • Italy, Bari (Osservatorio Sismologico, Universita di Bari)

  • Italy, Genoa (Genoa University Seismic Network)

  • Italy, Macerata (Osservatorio Geofisico Sperimentale di Macerata)

  • Italy, Naples (Osservatorio Vesuviano)

  • Italy, Rome (Mediterranean Very Broadband Seismographic Network)

  • Italy, Rome (Italian National Seismic Network)

  • Italy, Sicily (Sistema POSEIDON)

  • Italy, Trieste (Dipartimento di Scienza della Terra, Universita di Trieste)

  • Italy, Udine (OGS: Dipartimento Centro di Ricerche Sismologiche)

  • Jordan, Amman (Jordan Seismological Observatory)

  • Kazakhstan Republic, Almaty (Kazakhstan National Data Center, Institute of Geophysical Research)

  • Kuweit, Safat (Kuweit Institute for Scientific Research)

  • Libanon, Beyrouth (Centre National de Recherches de Géophysiques)

  • Lithuania, Vilnius (Geological Survey of Lithuania)

  • Macedonia, Skopje (Seismological Observatory)

  • Malta, Msida (Seismic Monitoring and Research Unit, University of Malta)

  • Montenegro, Podgorica (Montenegro Seismological Observatory)

  • Morocco, Rabat (Departement de Physique du Globe)

  • Morocco, Rabat (Centre National de Coordination et de Planification de la Recherche Scientifique et Technique, Geophysics Laboratory)

  • Netherlands, De Bilt (Observatories and Research Facilities for EUropean Seismology)

  • Netherlands, De Bilt (Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute)

  • Netherlands, Utrecht (Network of Autonomously Registrating Stations)

  • Norway, Kjeller (Norwegian Seismic Array)

  • Norway, Bergen (Institute of Solid Earth Physics)

  • Oman, Oman (Earthquake Monitoring Center, Sultan Qaboos University)

  • Poland, Warsaw (Institute of Geophysics, Polish Academy of Sciences)

  • Portugal, Lisbon (` Instituto de Meteorologia, Seismologia <http://www.meteo.pt/en/index.html>`_)

  • Portugal, Lisbon (Instituto Superior Tecnico)

  • Portugal, Lisbon (Geophysical Centre of the University of Lisbon)

  • Portugal, Azores, Ponta Delgada (Instituto de Meteorologia, Azores University)

  • Romania, Bucharest (National Institute for Earth Physics)

  • Russia, Apatity (Kola Regional Seismological Center, Russian Academy of Sciences)

  • Russia, Irkutsk (Baikal Branch Geophysical Survey of the Siberian Branch Russian Academy of Sciences)

  • Russia, Novosibirsk (Geophysical Survey of the Siberian Branch Russian Academy of Sciences)

  • Russia, Novosibirsk (Altay-Sayan Branch Geophysical Survey of the Siberian Branch Russian Academy of Sciences (ASB GS SB RAS))

  • Russia, Obninsk (Seismic Network of the Russian Academy of Sciences)

  • Russia, Obninsk (Teleseismic network of Russia)

  • Russia, Obninsk (Northern Caucasus Regional Seismic Network)

  • Russia, Obninsk (Dagestan Local Seismic Network)

  • Russia, Obninsk (Caucasus Mineral Waters Local Seismic Network)

  • Russia, Yakutsk (Yakutia Branch Geophysical Survey of the Siberian Branch Russian Academy of Sciences)

  • Saudi Arabia, Riyadh (King Abdulaziz City for Science and Technology)

  • Serbia, Belgrado (Seismological Survey of Serbia)

  • Slovakia, Bratislava (Department of Seismology, Geophysical Institute, Slovak Academy of Sciences)

  • Slovenia, Ljubljana (Environmental Agency of the Republic of Slovenia, Seismological Office)

  • Spain, Barcelona (Insitute d’Estudis Catalans, Lab. d’Estudis Geofisics “Eduard Fontsere”)

  • Spain, Barcelona (Geological Survey of Catalonia, Geological Institute of Catalonia)

  • Spain, Ebre (Observatori de l’Ebre)

  • Spain, Granada (Instituto Andaluz de Geofisica)

  • Spain, Madrid (Instituto Geografico Nacional)

  • Spain, Madrid (Universisdad Complutense, Department of Geophysics and Meteorology)

  • Spain, San Fernando (Royal Naval Institute and Observatory)

  • Sweden, Uppsala (Geophysics Department, Uppsala University)

  • Switzerland, Zürich (Swiss Seismological Service)

  • Tunisia, Tunis (Seismological Service, Institut National de la Meteorologie)

  • Türkiye, Ankara (Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency)

  • Türkiye, Ankara (Disaster and Emergency Management Presidency)

  • Türkiye, Istanbul (Kandilli Observatory and Earthquake Research Institute)

  • Türkiye, Gebze-Kocaeli (Tubitak Marmara Research Center)

  • Türkiye, Erzurum (Earthquake Research Centre, Ataturk University)

  • UK, Edinburgh (British Geological survey)

  • Ukraine, Lviv (Carpathian seismoactive region)

  • Ukraine, Kiev (National Academy of Sciences, National Center for Seismological Data)

  • Ukraine, Kiev (Main Center of Special Monitoring of the State Space Agency of Ukraine)

  • Ukraine, Kiev (Crimean seismoactive region)

  • Uzbekistan, Tashkent (Institute of Seismology of the Academy of Sciences)

  • Yemen, Dhamar (National Seismological Observatory)

  • France, Strasbourg (Bureau Central Sismologique Français)
